trans-unit.source: Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight using the Azure preview portal | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight using the Azure preview portal | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to administer HDInsight Service. Create an HDInsight cluster, open the interactive JavaScript console, and open the Hadoop command console.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to administer HDInsight Service. Create an HDInsight cluster, open the interactive JavaScript console, and open the Hadoop command console.

trans-unit.source: Using the <linkText>Azure preview portal[azure-portal]</linkText><title></title>, you can provision Hadoop clusters in Azure HDInsight, change Hadoop user password, and enable Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) so you can access the Hadoop command console on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Using the <linkText>Azure preview portal[azure-portal]</linkText><title></title>, you can provision Hadoop clusters in Azure HDInsight, change Hadoop user password, and enable Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) so you can access the Hadoop command console on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight by using the Azure portal</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight by using the Azure portal</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The steps in this document are specific to working with Windows-based Hadoop clusters.
trans-unit.target: The steps in this document are specific to working with Windows-based Hadoop clusters.

trans-unit.source: For information on working with Linux-based clusters, see <linkText>Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight by using the Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For information on working with Linux-based clusters, see <linkText>Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight by using the Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: There are also other tools available for administering HDInsight in addition to the preview portal.
trans-unit.target: There are also other tools available for administering HDInsight in addition to the preview portal.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Administer HDInsight Using Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Administer HDInsight Using Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Administer HDInsight Using Azure CLI</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Administer HDInsight Using Azure CLI</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this article, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this article, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Get Azure free trial</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Get Azure free trial</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage account - An HDInsight cluster uses an Azure Blob storage container as the default file system.
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage account - An HDInsight cluster uses an Azure Blob storage container as the default file system.

trans-unit.source: For more information about how Azure Blob storage provides a seamless experience with HDInsight clusters, see <linkText>Use Azure Blob Storage with HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about how Azure Blob storage provides a seamless experience with HDInsight clusters, see <linkText>Use Azure Blob Storage with HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For details on creating an Azure Storage account, see <linkText>How to Create a Storage Account</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For details on creating an Azure Storage account, see <linkText>How to Create a Storage Account</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For the provision instructions using the preview portal, see <linkText>Provision HDInsight clusters</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For the provision instructions using the preview portal, see <linkText>Provision HDInsight clusters</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight works with a wide range of Hadoop components.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight works with a wide range of Hadoop components.

trans-unit.source: For the list of the components that have been verified and supported, see <linkText>What version of Hadoop is in Azure HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For the list of the components that have been verified and supported, see <linkText>What version of Hadoop is in Azure HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can customize HDInsight by using one of the following options:
trans-unit.target: You can customize HDInsight by using one of the following options:

trans-unit.source: Use Script Action to run custom scripts that can customize a cluster to either change cluster configuration or install custom components such as Giraph or Solr.
trans-unit.target: Use Script Action to run custom scripts that can customize a cluster to either change cluster configuration or install custom components such as Giraph or Solr.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Customize HDInsight cluster using Script Action</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Customize HDInsight cluster using Script Action</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Use the cluster customization parameters in the HDInsight .NET SDK or Azure PowerShell during cluster provisioning.
trans-unit.target: Use the cluster customization parameters in the HDInsight .NET SDK or Azure PowerShell during cluster provisioning.

trans-unit.source: These configuration changes are then preserved through the lifetime of the cluster and are not affected by cluster node reimages that Azure platform periodically performs for maintenance.
trans-unit.target: These configuration changes are then preserved through the lifetime of the cluster and are not affected by cluster node reimages that Azure platform periodically performs for maintenance.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using the cluster customization parameters, see <linkText>Provision HDInsight clusters</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on using the cluster customization parameters, see <linkText>Provision HDInsight clusters</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Some native Java components, like Mahout and Cascading, can be run on the cluster as JAR files.
trans-unit.target: Some native Java components, like Mahout and Cascading, can be run on the cluster as JAR files.

trans-unit.source: These JAR files can be distributed to Azure Blob storage, and submitted to HDInsight clusters through Hadoop job submission mechanisms.
trans-unit.target: These JAR files can be distributed to Azure Blob storage, and submitted to HDInsight clusters through Hadoop job submission mechanisms.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Submit Hadoop jobs programmatically</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Submit Hadoop jobs programmatically</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If you have issues deploying JAR files to HDInsight clusters or calling JAR files on HDInsight clusters, contact <linkText>Microsoft Support</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you have issues deploying JAR files to HDInsight clusters or calling JAR files on HDInsight clusters, contact <linkText>Microsoft Support</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Cascading is not supported by HDInsight, and is not eligible for Microsoft Support.
trans-unit.target: Cascading is not supported by HDInsight, and is not eligible for Microsoft Support.

trans-unit.source: For lists of supported components, see <linkText>What's new in the cluster versions provided by HDInsight?</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For lists of supported components, see <linkText>What's new in the cluster versions provided by HDInsight?</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Installation of custom software on the cluster by using Remote Desktop Connection is not supported.
trans-unit.target: Installation of custom software on the cluster by using Remote Desktop Connection is not supported.

trans-unit.source: You should avoid storing any files on the drives of the head node, as they will be lost if you need to re-create the clusters.
trans-unit.target: You should avoid storing any files on the drives of the head node, as they will be lost if you need to re-create the clusters.

trans-unit.source: We recommend storing files on Azure Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: We recommend storing files on Azure Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: Blob storage is persistent.
trans-unit.target: Blob storage is persistent.

trans-unit.source: To access the cluster
trans-unit.target: To access the cluster

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <linkText>preview portal[azure-portal]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <linkText>preview portal[azure-portal]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Click Browse All from the left menu to open the Browse blade.
trans-unit.target: Click Browse All from the left menu to open the Browse blade.

trans-unit.source: Click HDInsight Clusters to open the HDInsight Clusters blade.
trans-unit.target: Click HDInsight Clusters to open the HDInsight Clusters blade.

trans-unit.source: Click one of the clusters from the list to open the cluster blade:
trans-unit.target: Click one of the clusters from the list to open the cluster blade:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>HDInsight portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>HDInsight portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Settings to see the configuration details and to configure the cluster:
trans-unit.target: Click Settings to see the configuration details and to configure the cluster:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>HDInsight portal cluster settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>HDInsight portal cluster settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: |Setting|Description| |-----|-----| |Properties| Display the cluster properties.| |Azure Storage Keys| Display the default Azure storage account information.
trans-unit.target: |Setting|Description| |-----|-----| |Properties| Display the cluster properties.| |Azure Storage Keys| Display the default Azure storage account information.

trans-unit.source: | |Cluster Login| Grant/revoke the HTTP web services access, and configure the cluster login information.
trans-unit.target: | |Cluster Login| Grant/revoke the HTTP web services access, and configure the cluster login information.

trans-unit.source: | |External Metastores| Display the Hive/Oozie metastore information.| |Scale cluster| Increase/decrease the number of workers nodes of the cluster.| |Remote Desktop| Enable/disable the Remote Desktop connectivity, connect to the cluster via Remote Desktop.|
trans-unit.target: | |External Metastores| Display the Hive/Oozie metastore information.| |Scale cluster| Increase/decrease the number of workers nodes of the cluster.| |Remote Desktop| Enable/disable the Remote Desktop connectivity, connect to the cluster via Remote Desktop.|

trans-unit.source: HDInsight clusters have the following HTTP web services (all of these services have RESTful endpoints):
trans-unit.target: HDInsight clusters have the following HTTP web services (all of these services have RESTful endpoints):

trans-unit.source: ODBC
trans-unit.target: ODBC

trans-unit.source: JDBC
trans-unit.target: JDBC

trans-unit.source: Ambari
trans-unit.target: Ambari

trans-unit.source: Oozie
trans-unit.target: Oozie

trans-unit.source: Templeton
trans-unit.target: Templeton

trans-unit.source: By default, these services are granted for access.
trans-unit.target: By default, these services are granted for access.

trans-unit.source: You can revoke/grant the access from the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: You can revoke/grant the access from the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: By granting/revoking the access, you will reset the cluster user name and password.
trans-unit.target: By granting/revoking the access, you will reset the cluster user name and password.

trans-unit.source: To grant/revoke HTTP web services access
trans-unit.target: To grant/revoke HTTP web services access

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <linkText>preview portal[azure-portal]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <linkText>preview portal[azure-portal]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Click Browse All from the left menu, click HDInsight Clusters, click your cluster name.
trans-unit.target: Click Browse All from the left menu, click HDInsight Clusters, click your cluster name.

trans-unit.source: Click Settings from the top menu, and then click Cluster Login.
trans-unit.target: Click Settings from the top menu, and then click Cluster Login.

trans-unit.source: Click ON or OFF on Cluster Login Access.
trans-unit.target: Click ON or OFF on Cluster Login Access.

trans-unit.source: For Cluster Login Username and Cluster Login Password, enter the new user name and password (respectively) for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: For Cluster Login Username and Cluster Login Password, enter the new user name and password (respectively) for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Click SAVE.
trans-unit.target: Click SAVE.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>hdinsight grand remove http web service access</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>hdinsight grand remove http web service access</linkText>

trans-unit.source: This can also be done through the Azure PowerShell cmdlets:
trans-unit.target: This can also be done through the Azure PowerShell cmdlets:

trans-unit.source: Grant-AzureHDInsightHttpServicesAccess
trans-unit.target: Grant-AzureHDInsightHttpServicesAccess

trans-unit.source: Revoke-AzureHDInsightHttpServicesAccess
trans-unit.target: Revoke-AzureHDInsightHttpServicesAccess

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Administer HDInsight using Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Administer HDInsight using Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: An HDInsight cluster can have two user accounts.
trans-unit.target: An HDInsight cluster can have two user accounts.

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight cluster user account is created during the provisioning process.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight cluster user account is created during the provisioning process.

trans-unit.source: You can also create an RDP user account for accessing the cluster via RDP.
trans-unit.target: You can also create an RDP user account for accessing the cluster via RDP.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Enable remote desktop</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Enable remote desktop</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To change the HDInsight cluster user name and password
trans-unit.target: To change the HDInsight cluster user name and password

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <linkText>preview portal[azure-portal]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <linkText>preview portal[azure-portal]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Click Browse All from the left menu, click HDInsight Clusters, click your cluster name.
trans-unit.target: Click Browse All from the left menu, click HDInsight Clusters, click your cluster name.

trans-unit.source: Click Settings from the top menu, and then click Cluster Login.
trans-unit.target: Click Settings from the top menu, and then click Cluster Login.

trans-unit.source: Change the Cluster Login Name and/or the Cluster Login Password, and then click Save.
trans-unit.target: Change the Cluster Login Name and/or the Cluster Login Password, and then click Save.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>hdinsight change cluster user username password http user</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>hdinsight change cluster user username password http user</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The cluster scaling feature allows you to change the number of worker nodes used by a cluster that is running in Azure HDInsight without having to re-create the cluster.
trans-unit.target: The cluster scaling feature allows you to change the number of worker nodes used by a cluster that is running in Azure HDInsight without having to re-create the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Only clusters with HDInsight version 3.1.3 or higher are supported.
trans-unit.target: Only clusters with HDInsight version 3.1.3 or higher are supported.

trans-unit.source: If you are unsure of the version of your cluster, you can check the Properties page.
trans-unit.target: If you are unsure of the version of your cluster, you can check the Properties page.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Get familiar with the cluster portal interface</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Get familiar with the cluster portal interface</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The impact of changing the number of data nodes for each type of cluster supported by HDInsight:
trans-unit.target: The impact of changing the number of data nodes for each type of cluster supported by HDInsight:

trans-unit.source: Hadoop
trans-unit.target: Hadoop

trans-unit.source: You can seamlessly increase the number of worker nodes in a Hadoop cluster that is running without impacting any pending or running jobs.
trans-unit.target: You can seamlessly increase the number of worker nodes in a Hadoop cluster that is running without impacting any pending or running jobs.

trans-unit.source: New jobs can also be submitted while the operation is in progress.
trans-unit.target: New jobs can also be submitted while the operation is in progress.

trans-unit.source: Failures in a scaling operation are gracefully handled so that the cluster is always left in a functional state.
trans-unit.target: Failures in a scaling operation are gracefully handled so that the cluster is always left in a functional state.

trans-unit.source: When a Hadoop cluster is scaled down by reducing the number of data nodes, some of the services in the cluster are restarted.
trans-unit.target: When a Hadoop cluster is scaled down by reducing the number of data nodes, some of the services in the cluster are restarted.

trans-unit.source: This causes all running and pending jobs to fail at the completion of the scaling operation.
trans-unit.target: This causes all running and pending jobs to fail at the completion of the scaling operation.

trans-unit.source: You can, however, resubmit the jobs once the operation is complete.
trans-unit.target: You can, however, resubmit the jobs once the operation is complete.

trans-unit.source: HBase
trans-unit.target: HBase

trans-unit.source: You can seamlessly add or remove nodes to your HBase cluster while it is running.
trans-unit.target: You can seamlessly add or remove nodes to your HBase cluster while it is running.

trans-unit.source: Regional Servers are automatically balanced within a few minutes of completing the scaling operation.
trans-unit.target: Regional Servers are automatically balanced within a few minutes of completing the scaling operation.

trans-unit.source: However, you can also manually balance the regional servers by logging into the headnode of cluster and running the following commands from a command prompt window:
trans-unit.target: However, you can also manually balance the regional servers by logging into the headnode of cluster and running the following commands from a command prompt window:

trans-unit.source: pushd %HBASE_HOME%\bin hbase shell balancer
trans-unit.target: pushd %HBASE_HOME%\bin hbase shell balancer

trans-unit.source: For more information on using the HBase shell, see []
trans-unit.target: For more information on using the HBase shell, see []

trans-unit.source: Storm
trans-unit.target: Storm

trans-unit.source: You can seamlessly add or remove data nodes to your Storm cluster while it is running.
trans-unit.target: You can seamlessly add or remove data nodes to your Storm cluster while it is running.

trans-unit.source: But after a successful completion of the scaling operation, you will need to rebalance the topology.
trans-unit.target: But after a successful completion of the scaling operation, you will need to rebalance the topology.

trans-unit.source: Rebalancing can be accomplished in two ways:
trans-unit.target: Rebalancing can be accomplished in two ways:

trans-unit.source: Storm web UI
trans-unit.target: Storm web UI

trans-unit.source: Command-line interface (CLI) tool
trans-unit.target: Command-line interface (CLI) tool

trans-unit.source: Please refer to the <linkText>Apache Storm documentation</linkText><title></title> for more details.
trans-unit.target: Please refer to the <linkText>Apache Storm documentation</linkText><title></title> for more details.

trans-unit.source: The Storm web UI is available on the HDInsight cluster:
trans-unit.target: The Storm web UI is available on the HDInsight cluster:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>hdinsight storm scale rebalance</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>hdinsight storm scale rebalance</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Here is an example how to use the CLI command to rebalance the Storm topology:
trans-unit.target: Here is an example how to use the CLI command to rebalance the Storm topology:

trans-unit.source: To scale clusters
trans-unit.target: To scale clusters

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <linkText>preview portal[azure-portal]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <linkText>preview portal[azure-portal]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Click Browse All from the left menu, click HDInsight Clusters, click your cluster name.
trans-unit.target: Click Browse All from the left menu, click HDInsight Clusters, click your cluster name.

trans-unit.source: Click Settings from the top menu, and then click Scale Cluster.
trans-unit.target: Click Settings from the top menu, and then click Scale Cluster.

trans-unit.source: Enter Number of Worker nodes.
trans-unit.target: Enter Number of Worker nodes.

trans-unit.source: The limit on the number of cluster node varies among Azure subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: The limit on the number of cluster node varies among Azure subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: You can contact billing support to increase the limit.
trans-unit.target: You can contact billing support to increase the limit.

trans-unit.source: The cost information will reflect the changes you have made to the number of nodes.
trans-unit.target: The cost information will reflect the changes you have made to the number of nodes.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>hdinsight hadoop hbase storm spark scale</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>hdinsight hadoop hbase storm spark scale</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The credentials for the cluster that you provided at its creation give access to the services on the cluster, but not to the cluster itself through Remote Desktop.
trans-unit.target: The credentials for the cluster that you provided at its creation give access to the services on the cluster, but not to the cluster itself through Remote Desktop.

trans-unit.source: You can turn on Remote Desktop access when you provision a cluster or after a cluster is provisioned.
trans-unit.target: You can turn on Remote Desktop access when you provision a cluster or after a cluster is provisioned.

trans-unit.source: For the instructions about enabling Remote Desktop at provision, see <linkText>Provision HDInsight cluster</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For the instructions about enabling Remote Desktop at provision, see <linkText>Provision HDInsight cluster</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To enable Remote Desktop
trans-unit.target: To enable Remote Desktop

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <linkText>preview portal[azure-portal]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <linkText>preview portal[azure-portal]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Click Browse All from the left menu, click HDInsight Clusters, click your cluster name.
trans-unit.target: Click Browse All from the left menu, click HDInsight Clusters, click your cluster name.

trans-unit.source: Click Settings from the top menu, and then click Remote Desktop.
trans-unit.target: Click Settings from the top menu, and then click Remote Desktop.

trans-unit.source: Enter Expires On, Remote Desktop Username and Remote Desktop Password, and then click Enable.
trans-unit.target: Enter Expires On, Remote Desktop Username and Remote Desktop Password, and then click Enable.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>hdinsight enable disable configure remote desktop</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>hdinsight enable disable configure remote desktop</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The default valus for Expires On is a week.
trans-unit.target: The default valus for Expires On is a week.

trans-unit.source: You can also use the HDInsight .NET SDK to enable Remote Desktop on a cluster.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the HDInsight .NET SDK to enable Remote Desktop on a cluster.

trans-unit.source: Use the EnableRdp method on the HDInsight client object in the following manner: client.EnableRdp(clustername, location, "rdpuser", "rdppassword", DateTime.Now.AddDays(6)).
trans-unit.target: Use the EnableRdp method on the HDInsight client object in the following manner: client.EnableRdp(clustername, location, "rdpuser", "rdppassword", DateTime.Now.AddDays(6)).

trans-unit.source: Similarly, to disable Remote Desktop on the cluster, you can use client.DisableRdp(clustername, location).
trans-unit.target: Similarly, to disable Remote Desktop on the cluster, you can use client.DisableRdp(clustername, location).

trans-unit.source: For more information on these methods, see <linkText>HDInsight .NET SDK Reference</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on these methods, see <linkText>HDInsight .NET SDK Reference</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This is applicable only for HDInsight clusters running on Windows.
trans-unit.target: This is applicable only for HDInsight clusters running on Windows.

trans-unit.source: To connect to a cluster by using RDP
trans-unit.target: To connect to a cluster by using RDP

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <linkText>preview portal[azure-portal]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <linkText>preview portal[azure-portal]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Click Browse All from the left menu, click HDInsight Clusters, click your cluster name.
trans-unit.target: Click Browse All from the left menu, click HDInsight Clusters, click your cluster name.

trans-unit.source: Click Settings from the top menu, and then click Remote Desktop.
trans-unit.target: Click Settings from the top menu, and then click Remote Desktop.

trans-unit.source: Click Connect and follow the instructions.
trans-unit.target: Click Connect and follow the instructions.

trans-unit.source: If Connect is disable, you must enable it first.
trans-unit.target: If Connect is disable, you must enable it first.

trans-unit.source: Make sure using the Remote Desktop user username and password.
trans-unit.target: Make sure using the Remote Desktop user username and password.

trans-unit.source: You can't use the Cluster user credentials.
trans-unit.target: You can't use the Cluster user credentials.

trans-unit.source: To connect to the cluster by using Remote Desktop and use the Hadoop command line, you must first have enabled Remote Desktop access to the cluster as described in the previous section.
trans-unit.target: To connect to the cluster by using Remote Desktop and use the Hadoop command line, you must first have enabled Remote Desktop access to the cluster as described in the previous section.

trans-unit.source: To open a Hadoop command line
trans-unit.target: To open a Hadoop command line

trans-unit.source: Connect to the cluster using Remote Desktop.
trans-unit.target: Connect to the cluster using Remote Desktop.

trans-unit.source: From the desktop, double-click Hadoop Command Line.
trans-unit.target: From the desktop, double-click Hadoop Command Line.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>HDI.HadoopCommandLine</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>HDI.HadoopCommandLine</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For more information on Hadoop commands, see <linkText>Hadoop commands reference</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on Hadoop commands, see <linkText>Hadoop commands reference</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the previous screenshot, the folder name has the Hadoop version number embedded.
trans-unit.target: In the previous screenshot, the folder name has the Hadoop version number embedded.

trans-unit.source: The version number can changed based on the version of the Hadoop components installed on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: The version number can changed based on the version of the Hadoop components installed on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: You can use Hadoop environment variables to refer to those folders.
trans-unit.target: You can use Hadoop environment variables to refer to those folders.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: In this article, you have learned how to create an HDInsight cluster by using the preview portal, and how to open the Hadoop command-line tool.
trans-unit.target: In this article, you have learned how to create an HDInsight cluster by using the preview portal, and how to open the Hadoop command-line tool.

trans-unit.target: To learn more, see the following articles:

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Submit Hadoop jobs programmatically</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: https://portal.azure.com
